conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram and apply the ideal gas law to find temperature changes.
The image shows a p-V diagram with states A, B, C, and D. Segment BC is a hyperbola.
Identify processes: A to B is isothermal, B to C is adiabatic, C to D is isothermal.
For isothermal processes, pV = nRT, and T is constant.
Since A to B is isothermal, temperature at B is 300 K.
Adiabatic process B to C does not change temperature, so temperature at C is 300 K.
C to D is isothermal, so temperature at D is 300 K.
The temperature of the gas in state D is 300 K.
